intro: Sabatia gracilis var. cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban slender ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom during the summer months. It is a perennial herb that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
